title: Kim Kardashian shares adorable shots of North and Saint ahead of Kanye West's Sunday Service
text:
Kanye West surprised Howard University students with his Sunday Service this morning, despite it being only Saturday.

The 42-year-old rapper was joined by Kim Kardashian and their eldest children, North, six, and Saint, three for the surprise spectacle.

Students on campus reportedly received an email at 6 a.m. on Saturday with an invitation to join in on the fun on the Howard Quad that began at 8 a.m.

Scroll down for video

Surprise! Kanye West surprised Howard University students on Saturday with Sunday Service on their quad

Kim gave fans a behind-the-scenes of her kids' ensembles ahead of the service.

North was dressed in an oversized lined tan colored jacket and taupe trousers for the event.

She teamed the look with white sneakers and large sunglasses of a squared shape.

Ready to go! North was dressed in an oversized lined tan colored jacket and taupe trousers for the event

Delicious! A thrilled Saint was sweetly seen gnawing at a photo frame of the family that was made out of chocolate

Saint opted for a similar look that was all white head-to-toe.

Kim and the children arrived into Washington D.C. on Friday night and was greeted with an array of sweet treats.

A thrilled Saint was sweetly seen gnawing at a photo frame of the family that was made out of chocolate.

And despite the late touch down following their trip to Armenia, Kim, Kanye and the family made it bright and early into Washington D.C.

Grammy award-winning R&B singer Tony Williams presided over the service with former murder convictees and D.C. residents Momolu Stewart and Halim Flowers taking the stage to tell their stories.

Star-studded: Grammy award-winning R&B singer, Tony Williams presided over the service with former murder convictees and D.C. residents Momolu Stewart and Halim Flowers took to the stage to tell their stories

They made it: Despite the late touch down following their trip to Armenia, Kim, Kanye and the family made it bright an early into Washington D.C.

The Washington Post reported that Kim had written a petition letter on Momolu's behalf to get him released from prison after more than 20 years. The pair were teens when they were convicted.

Howard University is one of the top five largest Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) in the US, with 86% of their 10,000 students African-American.

And while many thought Kanye's appearance was great, others slammed the rapper following his previous controversial comments on black American history and slaves.

'Aligning with Trump in my view is anti-black, full stop. But to go further here at Howard where so much was done for the liberation of black people, it's really gross,' The New Yorker's Briana Younger and Howard alum told The Washington Post.

Not fans: Some weren't happy about Kanye's appearance following his connection to President Trump and former views he's shared

People also took to Twitter to slam Kanye for visiting the university that saw actress Taraji P. Henson and Sean Combs attend.

'Kanye was apparently just at Howard. Hopefully he stopped by the African Studies department,' user Phillip Lewis tweeted.

The husband of Kim Kardashian previously called slavery a 'choice.'

'When you hear about slavery for 400 years — for 400 years?' he began while in the TMZ offices in May 2018.

'That sounds like a choice. Like, you was there for 400 years and it's all of y'all? It's like we're mentally in prison.'

Love: Kanye West has been married to Kim Kardashian for over five years (pictured 2012)
description: Kanye West surprised Howard University students on Saturday with Sunday Service on their quad. The students were emailed at 6:00 am about the surprise ceremony.
